alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Dickson; Hickman; Humphreys; Lewis; Maury; Perry; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 3:12PM CDT until July 18 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Lewis County in Middle Tennessee... Southern Dickson County in Middle Tennessee... Maury County in Middle Tennessee... Western Williamson County in Middle Tennessee... South central Cheatham County in Middle Tennessee... Perry County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Humphreys County in Middle Tennessee... Hickman County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 311 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles northwest of White Bluff to near McEwen to near Camden, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Franklin, Columbia, Dickson, Hohenwald, Centerville, Linden, Spring Hill, Mount Pleasant, White Bluff, Kingston Springs, Thompson`s Station, Pegram, Burns, Fairview, Lobelville, Gordonsburg, Kimmins, Bon Aqua, Busseltown and Primm Springs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 136 and 192. Interstate 65 between mile markers 50 and 63. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 32. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Cheatham; Dickson; Hickman; Humphreys; Lewis; Maury; Perry; Williamson
